Susceptible-Exposed-Infectious-Removed (SEIR) Model

Source: R/SEIR.R

This function is used by specific disease models in EPIRICE to model disease severity.

SEIR(wth, emergence, onset = 15, duration = 120, rhlim = 90,
rainlim = 5, wetness = 0, initSites, initInfection = 1, ageRc, tmpRc, rhRc,
baseRc, latrans, inftrans, siteMax, AGGR, RRPhysiolSenesc, RRG,
SenescType = 1)

Arguments

wth

a data frame of weather on a daily time-step containing data with the following field names.

YEAR

Year in YYYY format

DOY

Numeric day of year, e.g. 1 - 365

T2M

Mean daily temperature

T2MN

Minimum daily temperature

T2MX

Maximum daily temperature

RH2M

Relative humidity

RAIN

Precipitation
emergence

expected date of plant emergence entered in YYYY/MM/DD format (usually supplied through the disease model function)
onset

expected number of days until the onset of disease after emergence date
duration

simulation duration
rhlim

threshold to decide whether leaves are wet or not (usually 90%)
rainlim

threshold to decide whether leaves are wet or not
wetness

simulate RHmax or rain threshold (0) or leaf wetness duration (1)
init_sites

init_infection

age_rc

tmp_rc

rh_rc

base_rc

corrected basic infection rate
latrans

latent period
inftrans

infectious period
site_max

aggr

rr_physiol_senesc

relative rate of physiological senescence
rrg

senesc_type

Details

SEIR is called by the following specific disease models: predict_leaf_blast, predict_bacterial_blight, predict_brown_spot, predict_sheath_blight

Contents

  • Details
